name: Susan Athey: Tech Economists & Causation
description: World of DaaS podcast. How she 'invented' the Tech Economist role at Microsoft. The difference between prediction and 'what if' questions.

name: Susan Athey: Tech Economists Wanted
description: AEA Research Highlights. Why companies like Airbnb need economists to solve marketplace design problems.

name: Susan Athey: Economics & AI
description: Stanford GSB Fireside Chat on the intersection of economics and artificial intelligence.

name: Susan Athey: Economics of Transformative AI
description: NBER lecture on how AI is transforming economic research and industry applications.

name: Steve Tadelis: Causal Inference in Tech
description: UC Berkeley / ex-eBay. Deep dive into causal inference methods used in tech companies.

name: Hal Varian: Googlenomics Q&A
description: AEI podcast. The 'Adam Smith of Googlenomics' on auction design and why productivity metrics fail in the digital age.

name: Hal Varian: Chief Economist at Google
description: Room for Discussion. Why every company needs a chief economist for forecasting, pricing, and market design.

name: Hal Varian: Doing Economics at Google
description: CEPR interview on search economics, ad auctions, and forecasting with Google Trends.

name: John List: Scale, Uber & The Voltage Effect
description: EconTalk. Former Chief Economist at Uber and Lyft shares war stories on field experiments and driver incentives.

name: John List: Scaling Proven Ideas
description: How to scale ideas at Uber, Lyft, and Walmart. Why most interventions fail when you try to grow them.

name: John List: Market Design in Ride-Sharing
description: How ride-sharing platforms design markets for drivers and riders. Insights from Uber and Lyft.

name: Kyle Kretschman: Economics at Spotify
description: Causal Inference Podcast. A rare look at a working tech economist role — running experimentation teams at a streaming giant.

name: Pat Bajari: Building Tech Economics at Amazon
description: Keystone interview. How Amazon's Chief Economist built tech-economics from scratch with 400+ PhD economists.

name: Preston McAfee: Auction Design & Tech Economics
description: Chief Economist at Yahoo, Google, Microsoft. Golden Goose Award winner. Deep interview on auction theory, ad markets, and mechanism design.

name: Sean Taylor: When Do We Need Causal Inference?
description: Former Lyft/Facebook DS lead. This talk saves you from over-engineering. Know when correlation is enough.

name: ML for Pricing & Auctions (ICML)
description: Design the mechanism, don't just bid in it. RegretNet and deep learning for auction design.

name: Nikhil Devanur: Lagrangian Duality in Mechanism Design
description: Microsoft Research. How to design revenue-maximizing auctions using duality — simple auctions, budget smoothing, and optimal mechanisms.

name: Guido Imbens: Nobel Lecture 2021
description: Stanford, Nobel Laureate. The authoritative overview connecting the credibility revolution to modern instrumental variables and regression discontinuity.

name: Jean Tirole: Nobel Lecture 2014
description: Co-founder of two-sided market theory. Explains platform pricing and why traditional antitrust fails for digital markets.

name: Paul Milgrom: Nobel Lecture 2020
description: Auction Research Evolving. Traces development from theoretical foundations through FCC spectrum auctions to internet advertising.

name: Alvin Roth: Nobel Lecture 2012
description: Market design and matching markets. Directly relevant for economists at Airbnb, Uber, and similar platforms.

name: Victor Chernozhukov: Double/Debiased ML
description: MIT. The foundational Double ML methodology for high-dimensional causal inference. BFI presentation with accompanying DoubleML package.

name: Susan Athey: The Mixtape Podcast
description: Career journey from academia to pioneering the tech economist role at Microsoft. With Scott Cunningham.

name: Hal Varian: Conversations with Tyler
description: Episode 69. Google's shift from second-price to first-price auctions, quality scores, price discrimination, and nowcasting.

name: Glen Weyl: Radical Markets
description: Data as labor, quadratic voting, and mechanism design for platforms. Bridging theory and practice.

name: Erik Brynjolfsson: AI and the Economy
description: Stanford Digital Economy Lab. HBS Managing the Future of Work on J-curve of AI productivity and 14-35% productivity gains from AI.

name: Erik Brynjolfsson: Lex Fridman Podcast
description: Second Machine Age thesis. Which jobs are safe from automation and dangers of the Turing Trap.

name: Daron Acemoglu: New Tasks Framework
description: Social Science Bites podcast. When technology benefits workers vs. replaces them.

name: David Autor: AI and the Future of Work
description: MIT, NBER Co-Director. Fed SF presentation arguing AI's key risk is 'devaluation of expertise' rather than job loss.

name: Sendhil Mullainathan: Before AGI Podcast
description: MIT. Journey from behavioral economics to AI, algorithmic bias mitigation.

name: Sendhil Mullainathan: Cornell Messenger Lectures
description: 2024 three-part series on algorithms enhancing human capacity.

name: Keith Chen: Your Brain on Uber
description: NPR Hidden Brain. Uber economist on surge pricing psychology: users accept 2.1x surge more than 2.0x, low battery increases acceptance.

name: Why Uber Is an Economist's Dream
description: Freakonomics with Steven Levitt. Demand elasticity of -0.6 to -0.7 from 54M user sessions.

name: Uber Gender Pay Gap Study
description: Freakonomics. Jonathan Hall (Uber), Rebecca Diamond, John List. 1M+ drivers: 7% gap explained by experience and speed.

name: Fiona Scott Morton: Tech Antitrust Testimony
description: Yale, former DOJ Chief Economist. C-SPAN congressional testimony and Digital Markets Act analysis.

name: Tim Wu: The Age of Extraction
description: Columbia, former Biden Administration. Brookings TechTank on platform extraction and antitrust history.

name: Jean Tirole: Platform Regulation
description: NBER 2022 keynote on why traditional antitrust fails for digital platforms and the EU Digital Markets Act.

name: Jean Tirole: Richmond Fed Interview
description: Deep dive into pricing on both sides of platforms and the economics of 'free' services.

name: Alvin Roth: Google Tech Talk on Matching
description: Nobel laureate on matching markets. Directly applicable to marketplace platforms.

name: Ronny Kohavi: Experimentation Wisdom
description: The godfather of online experimentation. Decades of A/B testing wisdom from Microsoft and Amazon.

name: Alexey Stysin: Auction Mechanism Design
description: Data Science Tech Lead at Topsort, former Yandex. 7+ years building VCG auctions, ML for click prediction, and revenue optimization for search ads.

name: Casual Inference Podcast
description: Lucy D'Agostino McGowan & Ellie Murray. Highly technical discussions on A/B testing, DAGs, and causal methods.

name: EconTalk
description: Russ Roberts. The gold standard for long-form economic interviews. John List, Hal Varian, and more.

name: Not So Standard Deviations
description: Roger Peng and Hilary Parker on data science in the real world. Great for understanding the craft.

name: Freakonomics Radio
description: Economics applied to everything. Great for economic intuition and learning to communicate data insights.

name: Capitalisn't Podcast
description: Luigi Zingales, Stigler Center. Premier series on tech competition featuring Lina Khan, Carl Shapiro, Tim Wu.

name: Stigler Center
description: Full YouTube archives. FTC Chair Lina Khan keynotes, Stigler Committee Report on digital platforms.

name: The Mixtape with Scott Cunningham
description: Causal inference and tech economist careers. Features Susan Athey, Michael Luca, John List.

name: Conversations with Tyler
description: Tyler Cowen's long-form interviews. Tech economics episodes with Hal Varian, Marc Andreessen, and more.

name: HBS Managing the Future of Work
description: Bill Kerr, Joe Fuller. Erik Brynjolfsson on AI, gig economy series, and future of employment.

name: Jonathan.Interviews: Data Science Careers & Causal Inference
description: Senior data scientist with causal inference expertise. Practical tutorials on synthetic controls, event studies, Marketing Mix Models (Google Meridian), and data science career advice.

name: Causal Bandits Podcast (Alex Molak)
description: Causal Python channel. Deep-dive interviews on causal inference and causal AI with leading researchers: Judea Pearl, Julia Rohrer, Amit Sharma (DoWhy), Thomas Wiecki (PyMC).

name: Online Causal Inference Seminar
description: Regular international causal inference research seminar. Features Susan Athey on Synthetic DiD, Jakob Runge on Tigramite, and leading researchers on cutting-edge methods.

name: Econ AI Podcast
description: Interviews with scientists on cutting-edge business solutions. Guests include Matheus Facure (causal inference in fintech) and Vincent Martin (Meta) on economist-engineers.

name: Brady Neal: Causal Inference Course
description: Comprehensive causal inference video course. 16K subscribers. Guest lectures from Susan Athey, Alberto Abadie (Synthetic Controls), and Yoshua Bengio.

name: Aki Vehtari: Bayesian Data Analysis
description: Aalto University. BDA course lectures covering MCMC, HMC, model comparison, cross-validation (PSIS-LOO), and practical Bayesian workflow.

name: NBER: Methods Lectures & Feldstein Lectures
description: National Bureau of Economic Research. Methods lectures on causal inference (synthetic controls, RDD, DiD), Feldstein Lectures featuring Ben Bernanke, Gita Gopinath, and more.

name: MAD Seminar: Marketplace Algorithms & Design
description: Preston McAfee, Ramesh Johari, and others. Recorded talks on pricing, experimentation, and mechanism design in two-sided markets.

name: MIT CODE: Conference on Digital Experimentation
description: Talks from Meta, Google, Airbnb, Netflix economists on A/B testing at scale and experimentation platforms.

name: AEA Webcasts
description: American Economic Association. Includes Athey-Imbens ML and Econometrics course, plus sessions on LLMs for economics.

name: Economics of AI
description: NBER conference recordings on artificial intelligence and economics. Research presentations on AI labor markets, productivity, and automation.
